intro: Conyza schiedeana, commonly known as the Schiedea conyza, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Conyza schiedeana is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
